intro: Trichocoronis wrightii var. wigginsii, commonly known as the Wiggins' goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its dense, golden-yellow foliage and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically visited by bees and other pollinators. It has a low-growing habit and is well adapted to survive in dry conditions. The varietal form wigginsii is distinguished by specific morphological traits that set it apart from other varieties of Trichocoronis wrightii.
